functionalUnits.definition: The Engineering department is responsible for developing, maintaining, and scaling the organization’s software products and systems.
responsibilities: Developing new software features
Maintaining and improving existing systems
Ensuring the scalability and performance of applications
Collaborating with other departments to deliver technical solutions
Implementing best practices in software development

functionalUnits.definition: The IT Operations unit is responsible for managing the organization's infrastructure, ensuring the reliability and security of systems, and providing technical support.
responsibilities: Managing cloud infrastructure and on-premise systems
Ensuring system uptime and availability
Implementing security measures and monitoring
Managing networks, servers, and storage
Providing technical support to internal teams

functionalUnits.definition: Product Management oversees the planning, development, and execution of products, ensuring alignment with business objectives and customer needs.
responsibilities: Defining product strategy and roadmap
Gathering and prioritizing product requirements
Coordinating with engineering and design teams
Monitoring product performance and user feedback
Driving product development in alignment with market trends

functionalUnits.definition: The DevOps unit bridges development and operations teams to streamline software development, deployment, and infrastructure management processes.
responsibilities: Building and maintaining CI/CD pipelines
Automating infrastructure provisioning and configuration
Monitoring and optimizing system performance
Ensuring smooth deployment of software updates
Implementing Infrastructure as Code practices

functionalUnits.definition: The Data Science & Analytics unit focuses on leveraging data to provide insights, drive decision-making, and build predictive models for various business functions.
responsibilities: Analyzing large datasets to derive actionable insights
Developing machine learning models to solve business problems
Building data pipelines for data collection and processing
Collaborating with product and marketing teams to optimize strategies
Ensuring data quality and integrity across the organization

functionalUnits.definition: The Information Security unit is responsible for protecting the organization's systems, data, and networks from cyber threats and ensuring compliance with security policies.
responsibilities: Implementing security protocols and policies
Monitoring systems for vulnerabilities and threats
Responding to security incidents and breaches
Ensuring compliance with industry standards (e.g., GDPR, ISO)
Conducting security audits and penetration testing

functionalUnits.definition: The HR unit manages employee relations, recruitment, and talent development, ensuring the organization attracts, retains, and develops talent.
responsibilities: Managing talent acquisition and recruitment processes
Overseeing employee onboarding and training
Ensuring compliance with employment laws and regulations
Facilitating employee engagement and retention
Developing and implementing employee performance reviews

functionalUnits.definition: The Sales & Business Development unit is responsible for driving revenue by identifying business opportunities, managing customer relationships, and closing deals.
responsibilities: Identifying and pursuing new business opportunities
Developing and maintaining relationships with key clients
Negotiating contracts and closing sales
Collaborating with marketing to align on sales strategies
Managing sales pipelines and forecasting revenue

functionalUnits.definition: The Marketing unit is responsible for promoting the organization’s products and services through various channels, driving brand awareness, and generating leads.
responsibilities: Developing and executing marketing campaigns
Managing digital marketing strategies (SEO, PPC, social media)
Creating content for various platforms (blogs, ads, social media)
Conducting market research to understand trends and opportunities
Collaborating with sales to generate and nurture leads

functionalUnits.definition: The Customer Support and Success unit ensures that customers have a positive experience with the organization’s products by providing technical support and customer relationship management.
responsibilities: Providing technical support and troubleshooting assistance
Managing customer inquiries and resolving issues
Ensuring customer satisfaction and retention
Offering product training and onboarding
Collecting feedback and collaborating with product teams to improve offerings

functionalUnits.definition: The Network Administration unit is responsible for managing and maintaining the organization’s network infrastructure, ensuring connectivity and optimal performance.
responsibilities: Configuring and maintaining network equipment (routers, switches, firewalls)
Monitoring network performance and troubleshooting connectivity issues
Ensuring network security and applying patches
Managing VPNs and remote access systems
Implementing and managing LAN/WAN environments

functionalUnits.definition: The System Administration unit handles the maintenance, configuration, and reliable operation of the organization’s computer systems, especially servers and infrastructure.
responsibilities: Installing and configuring server software and hardware
Managing user access and permissions on systems
Monitoring system performance and resolving issues
Applying patches and updates to operating systems and software
Backing up and restoring data to ensure business continuity

functionalUnits.definition: The IT Support / Helpdesk unit provides technical assistance to users, resolving hardware, software, and network issues.
responsibilities: Providing first-level technical support for employees or customers
Troubleshooting and resolving hardware/software issues
Setting up and configuring new user accounts and devices
Documenting support processes and solutions
Managing IT assets and inventory

functionalUnits.definition: The Information Security unit ensures that the organization’s data, networks, and systems are protected from cyber threats and complies with security protocols.
responsibilities: Monitoring systems for vulnerabilities and potential breaches
Implementing security protocols and ensuring data encryption
Responding to cybersecurity incidents and threats
Conducting security audits and assessments
Ensuring compliance with security standards (GDPR, ISO, etc.)

functionalUnits.definition: The Cloud Infrastructure Management unit is responsible for managing and optimizing the organization’s cloud services and infrastructure.
responsibilities: Provisioning and managing cloud resources (e.g., AWS, Azure, Google Cloud)
Ensuring cloud services are secure and cost-efficient
Automating cloud infrastructure using Infrastructure as Code (IaC)
Monitoring cloud environments for performance and security issues
Collaborating with development teams to deploy cloud-native applications

functionalUnits.definition: The Database Administration unit manages the organization’s databases, ensuring data integrity, availability, and performance.
responsibilities: Installing and configuring database management systems (DBMS)
Ensuring data backups and recovery systems are in place
Monitoring database performance and tuning queries
Managing user access and database security
Planning for database scaling and capacity

functionalUnits.definition: The Enterprise Architecture unit designs and oversees the organization's overall IT infrastructure and technology strategy, ensuring alignment with business goals.
responsibilities: Developing long-term IT architecture strategies
Ensuring technology systems and infrastructure are scalable and secure
Collaborating with stakeholders to define IT needs and solutions
Evaluating and integrating new technologies into the IT ecosystem
Creating blueprints for software and system architecture

functionalUnits.definition: The Software Quality Assurance (QA) unit ensures the quality and reliability of the organization's software products by testing and identifying defects.
responsibilities: Designing and executing test cases for software applications
Performing functional, regression, and performance testing
Identifying and documenting bugs or issues
Collaborating with development teams to resolve defects
Ensuring software adheres to quality standards before release

functionalUnits.definition: The Executive Leadership unit oversees the overall direction and strategy of the organization, providing leadership and making high-level decisions.
responsibilities: Defining the organization's vision, mission, and strategic goals
Making high-level decisions regarding operations and policies
Communicating with stakeholders and the board of directors
Overseeing company performance and ensuring financial health
Leading and supporting the senior management team

functionalUnits.definition: The Human Resources unit manages the organization’s workforce, focusing on recruitment, talent development, and employee relations.
responsibilities: Managing recruitment, onboarding, and employee training
Overseeing performance management and employee evaluations
Ensuring compliance with labor laws and company policies
Developing and managing employee benefits and compensation
Promoting employee engagement and workplace culture

functionalUnits.definition: The Financial Management unit is responsible for the organization’s financial planning, budgeting, and reporting, ensuring financial stability and growth.
responsibilities: Creating and managing financial plans and budgets
Monitoring and analyzing financial performance and risks
Overseeing accounting, auditing, and tax compliance
Managing cash flow, investments, and financing strategies
Providing financial reports to executives and stakeholders

functionalUnits.definition: The Project Management unit ensures successful execution of projects by planning, executing, and monitoring project progress and deliverables.
responsibilities: Developing project plans, timelines, and resource allocation
Managing project teams and ensuring collaboration
Monitoring project progress, risks, and milestones
Ensuring projects are completed on time and within budget
Communicating project updates to stakeholders

functionalUnits.definition: Operations Management focuses on optimizing the day-to-day functions of the business, ensuring efficiency and the smooth running of internal processes.
responsibilities: Overseeing the organization’s operational processes
Improving efficiency, quality, and productivity
Managing supply chains and logistics
Developing and implementing operational policies
Ensuring compliance with safety and regulatory standards

functionalUnits.definition: The Risk Management unit identifies, assesses, and mitigates risks that could impact the organization’s operations, finances, or reputation.
responsibilities: Identifying and assessing risks across the organization
Developing risk mitigation strategies and contingency plans
Monitoring compliance with risk management policies
Ensuring the organization has appropriate insurance coverage
Conducting regular risk audits and assessments

functionalUnits.definition: The Compliance and Legal unit ensures that the organization adheres to laws, regulations, and internal policies, minimizing legal risks.
responsibilities: Ensuring compliance with industry regulations and legal standards
Managing legal contracts, disputes, and litigation
Providing legal advice to management and employees
Overseeing corporate governance and ethics programs
Collaborating with external legal counsel when needed

functionalUnits.definition: The Strategic Planning unit is responsible for long-term business planning and aligning organizational goals with market opportunities.
responsibilities: Developing and updating the organization's strategic plan
Identifying growth opportunities and market trends
Aligning business goals with operational capabilities
Collaborating with department heads to set long-term goals
Monitoring the implementation of strategic initiatives

functionalUnits.definition: The Marketing Management unit oversees marketing strategy, brand development, and the promotion of products and services.
responsibilities: Developing marketing strategies to promote products and services
Managing brand identity and corporate communications
Coordinating marketing campaigns and promotional activities
Conducting market research to understand customer needs
Monitoring marketing performance and ROI

functionalUnits.definition: Sales Management focuses on driving revenue growth by overseeing sales strategies, managing customer relationships, and achieving sales targets.
responsibilities: Developing sales strategies and setting sales targets
Managing sales teams and ensuring collaboration
Building and maintaining relationships with key customers
Overseeing sales performance and reporting on KPIs
Collaborating with marketing and product teams to drive growth

softwareEcosystemUnits.definition: The Requirements Engineering unit is responsible for gathering, analyzing, documenting, and managing the functional and non-functional requirements of a software product.
responsibilities: Eliciting and documenting software requirements from stakeholders
Analyzing and validating requirements for feasibility and alignment with business goals
Creating detailed requirement specifications and use cases
Managing and tracking requirements throughout the development lifecycle
Collaborating with development, design, and testing teams to ensure requirements are met

softwareEcosystemUnits.definition: The Product Owner is responsible for defining the product vision and strategy, prioritizing features, and working closely with development teams to ensure successful product delivery.
responsibilities: Defining and communicating the product vision and roadmap
Prioritizing and managing the product backlog based on business value
Collaborating with stakeholders to gather product requirements
Ensuring the development team understands the product goals and requirements
Making decisions about scope, release timelines, and trade-offs

softwareEcosystemUnits.definition: The Scrum Master facilitates Agile processes, removes obstacles, and ensures that the development team follows Agile best practices for iterative and incremental delivery.
responsibilities: Facilitating daily Scrum meetings, sprint planning, and retrospectives
Removing impediments that hinder team progress
Coaching the development team on Agile best practices and principles
Ensuring smooth communication between product owner and the development team
Monitoring team performance and ensuring continuous improvement

softwareEcosystemUnits.definition: The Software Architecture unit designs the high-level structure of software systems, ensuring scalability, reliability, and alignment with business goals and technical constraints.
responsibilities: Defining the overall software architecture and design principles
Ensuring scalability, performance, and security in system design
Collaborating with developers to translate architecture into code
Evaluating and selecting appropriate technologies and frameworks
Reviewing and ensuring adherence to architectural standards during development

softwareEcosystemUnits.definition: The QA unit ensures the quality of the software product by identifying defects, performing testing, and verifying that the product meets business and user requirements.
responsibilities: Developing and executing test plans and test cases
Performing functional, regression, and performance testing
Identifying, reporting, and tracking bugs and defects
Collaborating with developers to ensure defect resolution
Ensuring product quality through automated and manual testing

softwareEcosystemUnits.definition: The UX Design unit focuses on creating intuitive, user-friendly interfaces and experiences, ensuring that the product meets the needs and expectations of users.
responsibilities: Conducting user research and gathering user feedback
Designing wireframes, prototypes, and user interfaces
Collaborating with product and development teams to ensure alignment with user needs
Conducting usability testing to validate design choices
Refining and iterating on designs based on user feedback and data

softwareEcosystemUnits.definition: The Frontend Development unit is responsible for implementing the visual and interactive elements of a software product, focusing on user interface and client-side functionality.
responsibilities: Developing user interfaces using HTML, CSS, JavaScript, and related frameworks
Ensuring responsive and mobile-friendly design
Optimizing front-end performance and ensuring cross-browser compatibility
Collaborating with backend developers to integrate APIs
Maintaining and improving existing front-end features

softwareEcosystemUnits.definition: The Backend Development unit focuses on server-side development, managing databases, APIs, and core application logic to ensure smooth functionality of software products.
responsibilities: Designing and developing server-side logic and APIs
Managing databases and ensuring data security and integrity
Integrating backend services with front-end systems
Optimizing application performance and scalability
Collaborating with DevOps to ensure smooth deployment and operation

softwareEcosystemUnits.definition: The DevOps unit automates and streamlines the development, deployment, and operation of software, ensuring continuous integration, delivery, and reliable infrastructure management.
responsibilities: Building and maintaining CI/CD pipelines for automated deployment
Managing cloud infrastructure and automating infrastructure provisioning
Monitoring system performance and ensuring high availability
Collaborating with development and operations teams to improve workflows
Ensuring infrastructure is secure, scalable, and cost-effective

softwareEcosystemUnits.definition: The Technical Support unit provides post-release support, troubleshooting software issues, and ensuring customers have a smooth experience using the product.
responsibilities: Providing technical assistance and resolving customer queries
Troubleshooting software bugs and performance issues
Escalating issues to development teams when necessary
Creating documentation and FAQs for common support issues
Ensuring high levels of customer satisfaction and responsiveness
